results.description:
Janice Shaw will be teaching this class and her description is as follows (just like Anne's classes in Saugus). Thanks Janice!

We will meet 5 times at $5 per person per lesson. Let's plan to get to Panera/Beverly between 6 and 6:30 to eat; then we can tackle the lessons with a satisfied tummy. The lesson will begin at 7:00 for 5 consecutive Tuesdays (September 8 - October 6).

In the first weeks, I'll teach basic stitches and we can talk about realistic first projects. The final weeks will focus on getting you working on your own project. I will collect the full amount ($25) at the first lesson so I don't have to bother with collecting each week and I prefer cash so I don't have to go to the bank.

You will need a crochet hook in size H, I, or J and a skein of inexpensive "worsted weight" acrylic yarn in a solid, light color for the first class. In the same strip mall as Panera, there is a Michaels craft store where you can purchase these items when we meet on 9/8. Or you can go to a JoAnn's or AC Moore store. If you google these stores, you can probably find a coupon on their sites which will offer a discount off the full price and each store honors coupons from the others.

There will be homework. I will assign a small amount of homework intended to be completed over 3-4 days during the week intended to reinforce what you have learned that week.

This is the first of several scheduled classes, so sign up only if you can attend the dates and times listed here. There is a long list of women who are interested in learning to crochet. If you RSVP, please be sure you can attend. Same day cancellations and no shows will not be tolerated. You'll be marked as a no show and I won't be willing to include you in a future class. If you have any questions, please send me a message. I won't necessarily be monitoring this site.
results.name: Learn to Crochet/Beverly Panera TUESDAY nights

results.description:
CALLING ALL HEART PLAYERS!

                        Tonight we'll play HEARTS

        Bring your decks of cards and let the games begin!

Come join the C&C crew over at Not Your Average Joe's in Medford for a night of HEARTS.  There is always conversation and dinner first but then we can split up and play a few tables of HEARTS.

Whether you prefer board games, card games or party games (or just want to meet people!), Tuesday nights will be your opportunity! We welcome  new additions to the group, and it's great to see new friendships being made over board games...

Although we start around 6:30pm or so, early birds can take advantage of their half-price happy hour menu. These are full-portion sized appetizers for real cheap! If not, you'll still be able to take advantage of the monthly specials.

HOW TO GET THERE

This location is easily accessible from Rt. 16, Rt. 28 and Rt. 93, and is walking distance from the T, near the new Station Landing apartment complex. Here is a map of the area.

By Subway: Take the Orange Line to Wellington. Walk over the skybridge and cross through the parking lot. Upon exiting the garage, you'll see a building complex (SL75) across the street. Cross the street and take a right. Follow around this building and you'll find Not Your Average Joe's on the opposite side of the street.

By Car: If you are driving, be aware that Station Landing is at the intersection of Rt. 16 and Rt. 28, and you can enter the Station Landing complex from the north-bound side of Rt. 28, or the east-bound side of Rt. 16. There are a number of stores in the Station Landing complex -- look for the Margarita's, Starbucks or Not Your Average Joe's signs. NYAJ is located right off of Rte. 28. Although there is free parking all around the building, we recommend that C&C members park in the garage underneath the restaurant.
results.name: HEARTS NIGHT  with  Good Friends and Food in Medford

results.description:
We start off chatting about our work, including setting goals for ourselves (which is entirely optional but super helpful!), and then we write. That's what it's all about. As simple as the idea is, it's amazing how much more you can get done simply by being in the presence of other writers at work. The baked goods don't hurt, either.


There is power for laptops, and some of us use pen and paper. Your choice! Bonus: there's no Internet access, so you can omit a huge distraction without even trying. And, although we are not a discussion group, there are many areas where people can go if they want to talk without being disruptive.

Please click here for detailed directions! The school can be a bit of a maze and I don't want anybody getting lost.
results.name: Quite Write: Writing Night!

Thank you in advance to Boomerang for sponsoring food for this event, and also supplying a presentation. Boomerang is a Unitrends subsidiary that helps IT departments migrate VMs to AWS, and remodels them as AMIs. 

Presentations:

Migrating and Replicating VMs into AWS: There are many reasons to replicate vSphere VMs into AWS, and many ways to do it. Not all of them are pretty. Join Boomerang, a Unitrends company, for an in-depth technical discussion covering the benefits and risks of migration, as well as an example process to replicate VMs into AWS, and to remodel these VMs as native AMIs. Use cases include one-way migration, using AWS for backup / DRaaS, and cloud bursting from VM environments into AWS. The speaker will also present a case study and inform the audience about free sandboxes for exploring VM migration.

Further details to follow. Contact Mark Annati, the moderator, at [masked] with interest. Thank you.

results.description:
Gentlepeople,

Learn about Mobile Payment Technologies at our September meeting in Wellesley.  Read on...

Tuesday, Sept 8 (this week!), your Boston Network Users Group, BNUG, will meet at Mass Bay Community College in Wellesley Hills to learn about mobile payment methods.  As usual, admission is FREE and open to all.  Munchies and Intermingling (M&I) starts at 6:30pm, the meeting will start at 7pm and must end by 8:30pm.

About the meeting: You've heard about Apple Pay.  Mobile payment technology has come a long way from the days of money via PayPal on a Palm Pilot. Cell phones are rapidly turning into wallets, and merchants are competing with device manufacturers and credit card companies to control this new direction. Apple Pay, Samsung Pay, Google Wallet, MCX, and many other players are competing for your tap.  We’ll look at some of the solutions, the basic technology behind them, and the politics as well.

About the speaker:  Josh Turiel runs an IT services firm in Salem, MA where he also serves as a City Councillor (which is why you don’t see him very often anymore at BNUG meetings) and was a past president of BNUG.  His company specializes in Apple and Windows small business integration, security, and mobile device management. He can be reached at [masked].

IMPORTANT: You need to have a (free) parking permit and directions.  These are located online (print yours) at http://www.bnug.org/parkingpermit  (Note that the meeting will be in room 325, so make sure you have taken a copy of the permit after 9/1.)


Please let me know if you plan to come or even if you may come so we can have enough space and munchies.  Thanks.

FINALLY, thank you for reading this far.  I'm always open to your comments and suggestions, and even your questions and clever jokes (especially the latter).

Regards,

-steve
Steve Isenberg
President, BNUG

PS: MBCC Students are encouraged to join us!
results.how_to_find_us: You need a parking permit...the permit has directions to the college and the meeting. See Details.
results.name: Mobile Payment Techologies (Apple Pay and Beyond)

results.description:
Have you always wanted to run a little stronger, a little faster, and have some motivated people around to help push you along? Well now you can have all of those things at the best Track workout ever.

Interest peaked? Read on for more details including the weekly workout.

Meet at the Harvard Track as usual. See what the workout will be below.


View Larger Map

The workout is a simple speed workout designed to add some variety to your run.

The rest of this details the workout and highlights a few things I think are important to remember. Skip it if you would rather just wing it and meet us at the track. We'll fill you in there.

If you have never run on a track before, don't worry if none of this makes sense right now. As much as I will try to prep you, it usually just takes a few laps around the track for all of this to sink in.

The Workout

The workouts vary on a weekly basis and are usually interval based. We sometimes do workouts that are fun and different. Come see what this weeks workout is!

What does that mean?

1. The distances (200, 400, 800, etc.) are the distances we run on the track. Each lap around the track is 400 meters.

2. Each lap is supposed to be run at a certain speed, based on your 5k pace. Don't know what your 5k pace is? Read my instructions below to calculate your 5k pace.

*3. The recovery interval (RI), which is indicated in parentheses, may be a specified timed interval or a distance that you walk/jog.

Things to remember

Track workouts are supposed to be FUN! Don't be intimidated or dread a track workout. This is supposed to be a fun supplement to your other "normal" runs. With all of us out there encouraging each other it should be a blast.

Bring a running stopwatch/wristwatch if you have one! Using the start/lap/stop function will help you pace yourself on each lap.

Don't push it! If something hurts or starts to feel tight, don't risk an injury because you ran too hard on your first track workout of the summer. We have plenty of time to ease in...

Bring water for the end!!!

5k pace instructions

Decide how fast you would like to run a 5k. Choose a time that is reasonable yet challenging. Convert that time to seconds, and divide the seconds by 12.5 (the number of 400 meter laps it takes to run 5k). That is your 5k pace.

As an example, I might decide a reasonable yet challenging goal time for a 5k is 24 minutes.

24 minutes x 60 seconds per minute = 1440 seconds

1440 seconds divided by 12.5 laps in a 5k ~= 115 seconds / lap

This means that I will run the workout according to a pace of 115 seconds / lap.

I will also have pacing charts available at the track, so don't fret.

Blog
results.name: Track Tuesday

The Longsword is the iconic fantasy Knight's sword - a two-handed, straight blade with a cross guard. The weapon may seem to be simple at first but is in reality a weapon of finesse and skill.

The class covers all the basics of footwork, attacks and defenses. Drills are developed from simple to complex; from rigidly choreographed to open-ended. Timing, distance and judgement are developed.

results.description:
A wise teacher once said, "What is the secret to meditation? That’s easy—don’t meditate.” When we sit down to meditate, we arrive on our our cushion with an agenda, an idea of what we going to achieve and accomplish, as well as fears about what we might not achieve and accomplish. This attitude is not restricted to meditation practice, but is true with many of our most cherished projects, in life and work as well as in spirituality. We come in early with a sense of what we are there to do. But in many ways, this agenda becomes our biggest obstacle and limitation. It ties us to expectations, rather than to the spontaneous and uncontrolled freshness of the present moment. The teaching of non-meditation challenges us to drop our agenda, to drop even our sense of “doing”. Instead, we enter the possibility that being itself is powerful.

Contact : [masked]

Teacher Profiles Lama Willa Miller's bio can be found here.

Please note: most of the friends who attend regularly are not Meetup members, so there are always more people attending than are signed up using this web site.
results.name: Non-Meditation with Lama Willa Miller

results.description:
Alrighty Horror Lovers,

It has been a bit since the last meetup, my apologies, the summer is always busy.  The good news though, we are heading into the fall, which is the best time for horror, by far.  

That being said, let's get it started!  

We have the opportunity to attend a free advance screening of The Visit.  I know M. Night Shyamalan has had more misses than hits, but I enjoyed most of Wayward Pines, so I'm willing to give him another shot.

If you haven't heard of The Visit, briefly:  it is the terrifying story of a brother and sister who are sent to their grandparents’ remote Pennsylvania farm for a weeklong trip. Once the children discover that the elderly couple is involved in something deeply disturbing, they see their chances of getting back home are growing smaller every day.

Or check out the website: The Visit


I have a limited number of passes, so they are first come first serve, just RSVP on the site, email is also fine.  Also, if you've never been to an advance screening, just know that you need to be there early because they always overbook these things.  I will be in line at the AMC Boston Common between 5:30 - 6pm on Tuesday 9/8.  

Figure we can watch the movie and maybe grab a drink and talk about it somewhere nearby afterwards.


Hope to see you there!

TY

results.description:
Recently, the U.S. and Iran came to a deal to forestall Iran from getting nuclear weapons. Though a notable success, what does the fact that 4 states have joined the nuclear club since the end of the Cold War say about the state of the nonproliferation regime? What can be done to strengthen it? And is it likely this deal will hold? And why is the the number "0.20" so significant? Let's talk it out over some good food and drinks!

Also, be prepared for something different this time around.  We're going to take a slightly more...experimental thing than a straightforward discussion.

results.description:
Girl Develop It is partners with Axosoft and General Assembly.  Register here.

Join the creators behind Axosoft's viral #ItWasNeverADress campaign and the Girl Develop It community for a conversation on how being conscious and collaborative leads to innovation.

In an effort to break down barriers and shift perceptions of women in technology—and all spaces—Axosoft used their tech superhero powers of collaboration, cross-functionality, and agility to offer up a radically reimagined women’s bathroom symbol.

This new symbol has started an international conversation that is picking up STEAM! Since the campaign launched just a few month ago, it has generated over 20 million impressions, received attention from every major media outlet, and is funding a scholarship at Arizona State University for a need-based student entering a STEAM (science, technology, engineering, arts, and mathematics) field.

In this inviting, and humorous talk, the instigator behind It Was Never a Dress, Tania Katan, shares tips for artful disruption inspired by agile methodology!

Register here.


About the Speaker

Tania Katan  Creator of #ItWasNeverADress, Axosoft 

Tania Katan is an award-winning author and creative instigator who believes in storytelling at all costs. Katan has performed her stories at the Edinburgh Festival Fringe, NPR Snap Judgment, TEDX, Comedy Central Stage, and more. Her work has been written about in the New York Times, Huffington Post, TIME, BuzzFeed, GLAMOUR, and others. Formerly a Curator of Literary and Performing Arts at a contemporary art museum, Katan made the audacious leap into technology and is currently the Curator of Code at Axosoft, because every rock star company needs a punk

*****Please Register here.  Your RSVP to this Meetup event does not RSVP to the event - please Register here.****
results.name: #ItWasNeverADress: A Conversation on Women in Tech with Everyday Superheroes

Our concept is simple: meet other travelers or expats, talk about where you've been and where they've been, and get inspired for your next trip. Everyone with an open mind and sense of adventure is welcome, whether you're a travel novice or an experienced travel junkie.

This month we'll meet at Tavern in the Square @ Porter Sq. results.description:
Next up is Alan Moore's Swamp Thing, Books 1 & 2! I'm looking forward to it!

There's a gap of 4 weeks again, not 3, since 3 weeks from now is the city's annual U-HAUL day, and people may not be keen on dealing with traffic.


For anyone considering alternate editions, this is issues #20-#34 (#20 was the first volume written by Moore).


The Bumf:

 
Before WATCHMEN, Alan Moore made his debut in the U.S. comic book industry with the revitalization of the horror comic book THE SWAMP THING. His deconstruction of the classic monster stretched the creative boundaries of the medium and became one of the most spectacular series in comic book history.With modern-day issues explored against a backdrop of horror, SWAMP THING's stories became commentaries on environmental, political and social issues, unflinching in their relevance.

If you plan on coming, once you've read the book please post one discussion question in the comments for this event. I'll bring a list of them with me, and as usual we'll have them there to draw from when we're looking for stuff to talk about. I won't turn you away if you don't, but let's make running these things a group effort!

For those who haven't been to the Comic Book Club before, it's pretty simple - we sit around, order some food and some drink, and we probe deep into the merits and meanings of our chosen book or books. I also bring along a list of questions (written by you!) to give the discussion a bit of structure - but don't worry - it's pretty casual!

The venue is the Friendly Toast, which is a very casual kinda place with plenty of room where we can easily be heard. Please note though, that it's best to bring cash - although supposedly their card minimum has been relaxed - perhaps even obliterated!

results.description:
Ilan Stavans discusses Quixote: The Novel and the World

This event is free and includes a book signing; no tickets are required.

Tuesday, September 8th, 2015, 7pm

Harvard Book Store

1256 Massachusetts Ave., Cambridge

Harvard Book Store welcomes ILAN STAVANS, general editor of The Norton Anthology of Latino Literature, for a discussion of his latest book, Quixote: The Novel and the World.

Quixote: The Novel and the World is the groundbreaking cultural history of the most influential, most frequently translated, and most imitated novel in the world.

The year 2015 marks the four hundredth anniversary of the publication of the complete Don Quixote of La Manchaâ€•an (sic) ageless masterpiece that has proven unusually fertile and endlessly adaptable. Flaubert was inspired to turn Emma Bovary into “a knight in skirts.” Freud studied Quixote’s psyche. Mark Twain was fascinated by it, as were Kafka, Picasso, Nabokov, Borges, and Orson Welles. The novel has spawned ballets and operas, poems and plays, movies and video games, and even shapes the identities of entire nations. Spain uses it as a sort of constitution and travel guide; and the Americas were conquered, then sought their independence, with the knight as a role model.

In Quixote, Ilan Stavans, one of today’s preeminent cultural commentators, explores these many manifestations. Training his eye on the tumultuous struggle between logic and dreams, he reveals the ways in which a work of literature is a living thing that influences and is influenced by the world around it.

Purchase the Book: Featured event books will be for sale at the event for 20% off. Thank you for supporting this author series with your purchases.

results.description:
Contact me [Jose (click the link, then click "Message")] for the address.

General board gaming. We have a good library of widely played board games, and people normally bring many more of them. We regularly run three to five tables of board games - this provides enough variety.  It is normal for people to get two or three games a session.  The game night format was inspired by Unity Games and the event is very casual and structureless.  If you have gone to one of the meetup's quarterly events you will know.

Q & A:

Q.  What types of games are played?
A.  Any type of board game.  Browse through the most popular games at http://boardgamegeek.com/ and that should give you an idea.

Q.  Until when do you play games?  Can I arrive later than 7pm?
A.  Until the last game of the evening ends, usually past midnight.  Yes, you can arrive later than 7pm, but you may have to wait for a new game to start if you do.

Q.  Should I bring something?  
A.  If you want, bring a game you feel comfortable teaching. There will be pizza and sodas served. Feel free to bring snacks or beverages to share or chip in $5 to $10 for the pizza/sodas in the pizza cup. 

Q.  I really want to play XYZ game, can we schedule it?
A.  Some people ask for interest in a particular game on the event comments below.  This may be the way to make sure you get to play the game you want. 

Q.  Where do I park?
A.  The driveway is the obvious spot, but eventually it will fill up on most of these game nights.  Some people do park on the street.  The soccer field parking across the street is a safe option and is the suggestion the town police gave me when I asked about overflow parking.
results.how_to_find_us: The house is just across from a soccer field.  If the driveway starts to fill up, the soccer field parking lot is a good option.

results.name: Discussion:   Amp Up Your Relationship

results.description:
• Heal the emotional wounds of past relationships
• Transform deep seated patterns of abandonment and rejection
• Let go of unhealthy dysfunctional relationships
• Develop the ability to remain centered in the core of your being
• Become truly loving and accepting of yourself
• Develop a warm magnetic presence that will draw others to you
• Cultivate inner beauty
• Increase your capacity to give and receive love
• Attract a healthy and loving partner
• Create healthier and more fulfilling relationships
• Develop a stronger connection with the higher power
• Learn to evolve spiritually through your relationships

 

 


My friend Sema was telling me about how she had fallen for a man, but he had not called her in some time. Sema told me that she felt this man would come back to her somewhere down the road. Yet she also acknowledged that on another level she was experiencing a fear of loss and that she didn’t feel that there was much hope for the relationship. Sema told me later that evening that she could never seem to hold onto the men that she truly wanted to be with.

Sema was obviously strung out on the man, but she was very disconnected from the underlying pain that was driving her. Sema’s head was just spinning in circles as she analyzed everything the man said or did and why he wasn’t with her at that time. I could see that the hurt buried within Sema was keeping her attached to the man in a very unhealthy way…

Does this sound familiar?

Many of us are struggling to find love. But no matter what we do, love always seems to evade us.

I’ve been there myself and I didn’t know if I would ever find the love that I desired. But I persevered because I was very determined to heal and have someone special in my life. I discovered a series of practices that have enabled me to heal the emotional wounds and to develop a magnetic presence. These practices are making it possible for me to attract more loving partners and to create healthier and more fulfilling relationships. I have now decided to share these practices and understandings so that others can also create more love and intimacy and to attract someone truly special.

Open Your Heart by Healing the Emotional Wounds That Carry Over From Childhood and Past Loves
Most of us are still carrying the emotional wounds from our childhood and our past loves. We try to block the hurtful feelings and memories out of our awareness. But these feelings and experiences remain trapped within our body and mind. We then give off a vibe that causes us to attract and become attracted to dysfunctional people who create even more confusion, pain and suffering in our lives.

Learn to “digest” the emotional baggage that keeps you trapped in unfulfilling relationships. Transform the deep seated patterns that cause you to attract people who are negative or abusive or who do not have the capacity to truly love you and be present with you.

Heal the loss of past loves. Heal the shame and the feelings unworthiness, rejection and abandonment. Become clearer about what you really want in life and in a companion. You will naturally attract and find yourself attracted to healthier people as you heal the wounded parts of yourself. More and more love will flow to you as you begin to experience true love and acceptance for yourself. Working with these practices will make it possible for you to cultivate inner beauty and to develop a presence that is very healing to others.

Develop the Kind of Warm Magnetic Presence That Will Attract a Healthy and Loving Partner
Many of us have learned to disconnect from our emotions and are not very present within our bodies. The stresses, emotions and life experiences that we fail to digest accumulate within our body and mind. These stagnant energies and emotions can extinguish our inner fire and passion. Stagnant energies decrease our desirability which makes us less attractive to others.

A body that if full of vital life force is infinitely more desirable. Become powerfully present while remaining centered within the core of your being. Exude warmth, passion, sensuality and desire.

Develop Your Intuition and Sensory Awareness
Heightened intuition and sensory awareness lets us know when it is safe for us to open up to another person. It helps us to understand where people are coming from. Our intuition also guides us to the people that we are meant to be with.

Use Your Relationships to Evolve Spiritually
Healing the hurts and resolving the issues awakens the part of the soul that resides within your body. Awakening your body-mind will enable you to develop a stronger connection with your higher self and the universal consciousness.

Develop Chi Power
Many systems of Chinese martial arts emphasize the development of the dan tien, which is our base of power in the lower abdomen. You will learn specific chi gong practices that will enable you to continually cultivate the chi/shakthi in the dan tien. Developing Chi Power enables you to create a powerful magnetic presence that draws others to you.

Create Healthier and More Fulfilling Relationships
Relationships have a way of bringing our core issues to the surface. Buried emotions and unresolved issues create barriers between ourselves and others. Our love grows stronger and our understanding deepens as we learn to “digest” our emotions, resolve important issues and express our feelings and needs in a healthy way.

Ben was drawn to indigenous cultures from an early age and found himself living among the Kiowa Tribe in Oklahoma at the age of seventeen. He began his training with Horace Daukei, the last surviving traditional doctor (medicine man) among the Kiowa Tribe. Ben went on to study with Chinese Master Li Tai Liang. He continues to train intensively in the Chinese systems of xin yi, bagua, tai chi and chi gong.

results.description:
Meditation practice gives us a chance to step away from the busy-ness of our day-to-day lives. It provides space for us to be free from reaction, from expectation, from doing, and step into the gentle space of being.

This weekly practice consists of 25-30 minutes of guided Vipassana meditation followed by a brief discussion. Vipassana meditation encourages us to experience each moment exactly how it is, fostering presence and awareness.

In this practice we allow thoughts, emotions, and all other stimuli to surface. We become a witness of these, cultivating a space of non-attachment and revealing a deeper connection with one's inner self.

Newcomers to meditation and long-time practitioners are welcome to attend. This is a FREE practice. There is a suggested donation, but that is not required to attend.

results.description:
Tuesday, September 8
7:30 PM, Fox Library Community Room
Yellow Rails in Louisiana
David Larson is an experienced leader of birding and natural history expeditions that have gone all over the world. He has led two trips to southwestern Louisiana to look for birds, eat Cajun food and let the good times roll. These trips are timed to take advantage of the late-season rice harvest, where migratory birds such as yellow and Virginia rails, white-faced ibises, and soras are flushed from the rice fields by the combines. In his illustrated presentation, he will virtually take audience members along on one of these trips to the wetlands of Cajun country, highlighting the sights and especially the birds. The fall visits to Cajun country have been such a success that a third trip is planned this November. Larson confirms that every participant so far has seen yellow rails — one of the most elusive birds in North America
results.name: Talk on finding Yellow Rails in Louisiana

results.description:
Awaken the Healing Power within Your Body and Mind


·  Awaken your body and mind’s innate healing power

·  Develop healthier and more fulfilling relationships

·  Learn to work constructively with your own emotions

·  Stimulate your minds innate problem solving capabilities

·  Develop new resources and capabilities

·  Become clear about your life’s purpose

Our bodies communicate with us all the time. Many of us are so over stimulated and stressed out that we cannot hear what our bodies are saying. We age faster and suffer many health problems when we do not know how to listen to what our body is telling us.

Discover the amazing wisdom that resides within your own body. Ben will show you how to develop your sensory awareness. Learn to truly listen to your body and care for its needs.

Stimulate the mind's creative problem solving capabilities by learning to "digest" issues, emotions and stresses

Many of us have never learned how to work with difficult issues and emotions. We tend to push these things down inside of ourselves. Undigested thoughts, issues, emotions and the stresses of daily life create a residue that accumulates within the tissues and organs of our bodies. That creates a great deal of additional stress upon our body and mind. These stresses can arrest our process of development, disconnect us from the divine creative intelligence of the universe and shut down our intuition. It also causes our bodies break down at a more rapid pace and that accelerates the aging process.

Learn to use your body-mind's innate healing power to "digest and assimilate" your thoughts feelings, emotions, issues and life experiences. You will begin to release the stresses that are held within the body and to heal the painful emotions associated with anxiety, depression and emotionally traumatic experiences. You will also learn to go right to the source of the issues to bring about a resolution that allows you to really move forward in your life.

Working with these practices helps to increase your intellectual and emotional range, improve memory, initiate new cycles of growth, awaken inner passions, spark creativity and deepen intuition. You will develop the strength and resilience that will make it easier for you to adapt to the demands that life places upon you.

Discover the passion and power that resides within you

Chinese Martial Arts Masters emphasize the development of a base of power known as the "dan tien". The stress of living in such a fast paced world can cause us to disconnect from our foundation. Undigested food, emotions and the stresses of daily life begin to accumulate within the abdomen. We may experience bloating and suffer from various digestive problems. Some of us begin to lose touch with our drive, passion, inspiration and the sense of knowing that reveals our true purpose as our instinctual base shuts down.

You will learn to become fully present within your body, to develop greater personal power, and to awaken the inner passion and sense of knowing that will bring give you a greater sense of clarity about your life's purpose.

Activate the healing intelligence that resides within the body and mind

We all have a powerful healing intelligence that resides within our bodies and minds. This innate healing power helps to mend our bodies any time we suffer an illness or injury. Our innate healing powers are often compromised by the stress and toxins that accumulate within our bodies.

Learn to activate the generative healing powers that reside within your own body and mind. Awaken the consciousness of the individual organs. Access and heal the emotions and core issues that are held within the body. These practices are very effective for healing digestive and respiratory disorders and a wide range of other health issues.

results.description:
Ongoing class in 18th century Scottish Broadsword and Smallsword.


The Broadsword is the archetypal weapon of the Highlander swordsman - a broad-bladed cutting and thrusting weapon. It has a basket hilt to protect the hand and wielded single-handed.

The Smallsword is the courtly weapon of the Scottish warrior class. An elegant thrusting weapon it teaches the fighter to use the thrust and make small parries. The smallsword is the immediate predecessor to modern epee.

The class covers all the basics of footwork, attacks and defenses. Drills are developed from simple to complex; from rigidly choreographed to open-ended. Timing, distance and judgement are developed.


All classes begin with a Strength & Conditioning program designed to physically prepare one for fighting with the sword. Elements develop agility, core stability and power.
results.name: Scottish Broadsword & Smallsword

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball. 

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.

results.description:
Do you VEGETABLE-TARIANS want all the OTHER people (even if they have not committed to be vegetarians) to eat fresh produce?  Then help us - each Wednesday late afternoon - bag vegetables (and some fruit) for the neighbors in Mission Hill.  Usually there are also freshly-baked loaves of bread, also (baked that morning - Jessica's Bakery).

It's an assembly line, then take home a bag (or two) of produce for yourself. 

Bring your business cards, smartphone, or notepad, and prepare to exchange contact info with other volunteers you like.  Volunteers come from several sources (not merely this meetup or others:Craigslist, Pharmacy School, School of Public Health, etc.) 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
VOLUNTEERING for $2/bag of produce in Mission Hill
Tobin Community Center, 1481 Tremont Street
Mission Hill, Roxbury
(between Brigham Circle and Roxbury Crossing T stops)
Boston, MA 02120 - <2 blocks from Orange Line T Each Wednesday, from 4:00 - 6:00 pm (indoors in bad weather)

We will be VOLUNTEERING for the weekly Wednesday late afternoon $2/bag of produce in Mission Hill.

When you volunteer,
YOU will ALSO TAKE HOME one or two of those "$2 bags"!
We've had 55 volunteers, and we've had 7.  Workloads vary!

Fair Foods provides a 20-22 bag of produce for the Mission Hill neighbors so they can eat like me - on produce. The neighbors only need to pay' $2 for the bag.

Volunteers unload the truck, set up 3 banquet tables, set up the food in order of desntiy (potatoes on bottom - tomatoes and bananas and berries and kale on top), then fill each bag (and 'stack' them upright by one another - for the 'paying neighbors' to pick up (for $2).

We arrive around 4 pm (maybe as late as 4:30 pm) and work until 6 pm (can leave as early as 5:30 pm if we've finished).

In the FRONT of the Tobin Community Center, 1481 Tremont Street (between the Brigham Circle T stop - GREEN E-Line - and the Roxbury Crossing Orange Line T stop), behind the wrought iron fence.

Wear comfortable clothing that allows you to move flexibly and to actually work, lifting heavy bags of food. 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 
Tobin Community Center 
1481 Tremont Street, Boston, MA

THERE IS NO PARKING - IT'S BEST FOR THOSE WHO LIVE IN BOSTON AND TRAVEL IN ON THE MBTA

THERE IS NO PARKING IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD

Every Wednesday, from 4:00 - 6:00 pm 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 
Bring friends!  Forward the invitation to others!

Invite FRIENDS through the Facebook, LinkedIn, and Twitter 'share'
buttons
http://www.yelp.com/events/boston-volunteering-for-2-bag-of-produce-in-mission-hill-each-wednesday-afternoon-from-4-6-pm-at-tobin-community-center

Looking for an ARTIST to help VISUALLY REPRESENT this vegetable outreach effort. 
TALK with us FIRST !!

Looking for Gifted Marketers to 
(i) conceptualize the WHY of low cost vegetable distribution! and 
(ii) the desirability of TAKING the low cost vegetables !!

LOGISTICAL CHALLENGE IS TO GET LOW COST VEGETABLES to the REFRIGERATORS of LOCAL RESIDENTS !!!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 
Vegan Cooking classes or Vegan Cooking Ideas

Vegan Cooking Classes or  
Learning How to Prepare Vegan Food
(using the $2 bag of produce as a low-cost start) 


What Can You Do With Your $2 Bag? Portion Control Bake...Don't Fry! Roasted Veggie Stackers No-Guilt Banana Ice Cream Avocados!!! Salad with Chipotle Hummus Simple Cilantro Chutney More $2 bags of Produce! Drink your greens!
results.name: VOLUNTEERING for distributing $2/bag of produce in Mission Hill

results.description:
Admission to the MFA (The Boston Museum of Fine Arts) is free after 4pm on Wednesdays!!

We get together in the Longwood Medical Area on Tuesday evenings for bilingual chat, but just a few blocks away is one of the world's finest art museums (and it also has a section on Sinology or China studies).

If you attend for free on Wednesday evenings, you'll be asked to make a contribution, but such gifts are purely optional.

This would be a host-free meetup where you 'just go' and bring friends, if you wish. I suggest that our group bring different small groups of bilinguals with China interest to the MFA, and make that a topic of discussion.

results.description:
$20 to attend. Please be on time and sign up only if you're positive you can be present.


In this workshop we'll read your work and give you constructive suggestions to strengthen it. From larger structural and character considerations to minor formatting and story bumps, we'll help you make your script tighter, evocative, and more compelling. 


Please bring at least four copies of ONE of the following:

1. Ten pages of an original feature screenplay (or a ten or less-page short film) that you wrote yourself.
2. A treatment that you wrote yourself (one to two-page synopsis of the plot) for a proposed original screenplay. Please keep treatments to two pages maximum.


If you haven't written a script or treatment, then come with your questions and a willingness to provide constructive feedback for others.


Regardless of what you bring, be sure to PRINT OUT COPIES so that we can read it together. If you don't print them out, we'll have no way to workshop your work! At least four would be appreciated.

If you haven't written a screenplay or treatment but are curious about the process, then we definitely have a place for you. For beginners, we highly recommend grabbing a copy of The Complete Screenwriter's Manual (http://www.amazon.com/Complete-Screenwriters-Manual-Comprehensive-Reference/dp/0321397932) and screenwriting software (free: CeltX.com, more features: FinalDraft.com)

For more personalized script attention, I offer one-on-one screenplay coverage services. Details and testimonials: http://www.screenplay.guru. 10% off for Cambridge Screenwriting members.

We can't wait to see you!
results.name: Group Screenplay Workshop - $20

results.description: Wednesday evenings are a great mid-week option - we are making this a regular weekly meetup, so you can count on getting your tennis fix. The Cambridge Public Library has 3 tennis courts that are open and free. If the weather is good, there may be others already playing, so we will have to share the courts. Use the meetup discussions and RSVPs to coordinate with each other, and hope you get a good game of tennis and make new friends!
results.name: Wednesday Evening Mixed Doubles

results.description:
You may not know it, but the original parcel of land that founded the Audobon Society is not even one block off Beacon Street, right where Brookline and Boston meet. That piece of land is kept wild and free, and even though it’s small, you can find a bountiful variety of birds there – and wild medicinal plants!

The ability to identify and use each of these plants was once commonplace to every man, woman, and child, but today most of us have lost that knowledge. Come reclaim what’s yours!

Join us regularly throughout the growing seasons and learn the plants in all of their stages of growth. By the end of these sessions, you’ll feel confident in your ability to identify the many medicinal plants growing right in the middle of the city – and you’ll learn how you can work with them!

Wednesday, September 9th, 2015
5:30 – 6:30pm
Hall’s Pond Sanctuary, Brookline MA 02446

A map of our meeting place can be found here:
http://commonwealthherbs.com/halls-pond-herb-walk-brookline/

Meet at the gate near the tennis courts, just off Beacon Street near the Hawes Street T stop. We’ll get started right at 5:30 and wrap up by 6:30. Feel free to bring a notebook or sketchbook, cameras, etc. The fee for the herb walk is $5.

Herb walks are “Sprinkle or Shine!” – if it’s just damp or a bit drizzly, we’ll walk anyway. If it’s raining enough to need an umbrella, that makes it hard to learn, so we will cancel in that event.
results.name: Hall's Pond Herb Walk, Brookline

results.description:
WITI Networking Event: Exerting Influence Without Authority - What’s in Your Toolbox? - Wednesday, September 9, 2015 - 5:30 pm - 8:00 pm. Location: Cambridge IBM Innovation Center, First Floor, One Rogers St. (One Charles Park), Cambridge, MA. Price: $15 for WITI members and $25 for non-members.

On September 9, WITI Boston will host a networking event featuring management consultant Candice Benson, CEO of Benson Consulting Inc. speaking on the topic, “Exerting Influence Without Authority - What’s in Your Toolbox?” She’ll discuss techniques for leading teams that contain members over whom you have little or no formal authority.

During this session you will learn ways to develop skills and techniques such as:

- Constructive persuasion and negotiation

- Personal styles for effective communications

- Political support or access to important resources

Schedule of Events

5:30 pm - Networking and check-in

6:15 pm - WITI welcome and introductions

6:30 pm - Program

7:45 pm - Raffle prizes

8:00 pm - Meeting concludes


A light supper and beverages will be served.

We look forward to sharing insight and providing tools for you to further succeed in business or your personal life by exerting influence without authority!

About the Speaker:

Candice Benson, PMP, is an internationally recognized Management Consultant and the founder and CEO of Benson Consulting Inc. Candice, a true Change Agent, is an experienced PMO Director, Portfolio Manager, Program Manager and Project Manager and skilled Facilitator. She has been certified as a Project Management Professional (PMP) from the Project Management Institute and is a Six Sigma/Lean certified leader, mentor and certified Master Project Management Coach (MPC). Her true passion is seeing the unexpected end benefits that operational process improvements deliver to her clients, including radically enhanced innovation and creativity, world-class customer service and accelerated time to profit.

Candice volunteers her time to support WITI's mission and is Boston’s co-networking events director working with Deb Stark.

Register here:

http://www.witi.com/networks/boston/events/3015/Exerting-Influence-Without-Authority---What's-in-Your-Toolbox-/?
results.how_to_find_us: First floor
results.name: WITI Networking Event: Exerting Influence Without Authority

Herb walks are “Sprinkle or Shine!” – if it’s just damp or a bit drizzly, we’ll walk anyway. If it’s raining enough to need an umbrella, that makes it hard to learn, so we will cancel in that event.

results.description:
You may not know it, but the original parcel of land that founded the Audobon Society is not even one block off Beacon Street, right where Brookline and Boston meet. That piece of land is kept wild and free, and even though it’s small, you can find a bountiful variety of birds there – and wild medicinal plants!

The ability to identify and use each of these plants was once commonplace to every man, woman, and child, but today most of us have lost that knowledge. Come reclaim what’s yours!

Join us regularly throughout the growing seasons and learn the plants in all of their stages of growth. By the end of these sessions, you’ll feel confident in your ability to identify the many medicinal plants growing right in the middle of the city – and you’ll learn how you can work with them!

results.description:
Hi All!
A number of you have shown interest in a weekday evening meetup in the downtown Boston area. Here it is! Please come and join us for a casual 2 hours ASL social on Wednesdays from 5:30 to 7:30 pm.


WHO: All who are interested in ASL are welcome to join us. Whether you're Deaf or hearing, beginner or fluent ASL user, we're here to share and socialize in this beautiful language.

WHERE: We'll be in the City Place Food Court in Dept of Transportation Building (use entrance on Boylston Street across street from Boylston Street T stop or entrance on Stuart Street) . Since we'll most likely be the only group of people signing, we should be pretty easy to spot.

RULES: Voices off, use paper and pen if you need to--this helps us learn and its Deaf friendly


RESOURCES: For those of you who are new to ASL and want to come prepared, here are some very good websites with free online classes.

http://www.westwoodasl.com/ http://www.lifeprint.com/ http://www.start-american-sign-language.com/

RSVP: Please RSVP for the meetup that you will be attending so we know how many people to expect.

CONTACT: Please feel free to contact host (Sean) if you have any questions or concerns. Hope to see you there! :)
results.how_to_find_us: Look for people signing!
results.name: Downtown Boston Weekly ASL Social

results.description:
Come join us at our water training sessions! No prior experience necessary. New paddlers welcome at all times of the season.

Mon & Wed: 6pm - 8pm, meet 5.45pm by the grassy patch near Barking Crab.  
Sat: 11am - 1pm, meet 10.45am by the grassy patch near Barking Crab.

Price: New paddler 2-class pack for $10. All other paddlers paddle unlimited under the $110 annual membership fee. New paddlers who have purchased the $10 intro pack get a $10 deduction from $110 membership!

Outdoor paddling means exposure to the weather! Be prepared to get wet!

Clothing: Wear workout clothes, synthetic fibers that dry quickly are highly recommended. Bring dry clothes to change into afterwards.  
Footwear: Sandals or flip flops recommended. Some people go barefoot. Shoes and socks are not recommended.  
Other: Bring plenty of water and sunscreen.

All paddling equipment is provided (paddles, pfds). Locker provided on-site.

Please sign our e-Waiver before you get on the water

Hope to see you there!

Lily[masked]

 

In the event of inclement weather, announcements will be made through the comments area of each meetup event, also in Twitter, Facebook and email alerts.

Sign up for our weekly emails and email alerts

Twitter: @Boston1Dboat

Facebook: http://bit.ly/Boston1facebook

 

Parking: Channelside Parking at 284 A Street. Enter at 29-41 Necco Street, off Melcher Street. Weekend $6 flat rate.

Public Transport: Closest MBTA stop is South Station on the Red Line.
results.how_to_find_us: We meet on the grassy patch between the Children's Museum & the Barking Crab Restaurant
results.name: Wednesday Water Training

results.description:
Crafted
Objects in Flux


Discover the dramatic changes in contemporary craft in recent years.

Contemporary craft-based artists are finding new ways to fully explore their disciplines. Artists engage a broadened range of materials, conceptual practices, ways of making, and modes of display than those that have been historically associated with craft objects.

“Crafted” explores this moment of “flux” in the field, focusing on contemporary craft-based artists who bridge cutting-edge concepts and traditional skills as they embrace and explore the increasingly blurred boundaries between art, craft, and design. Featuring a selection of works from across the landscape of contemporary craft, the exhibition includes more than 30 emerging and established international artists. Looking to a broad range of materials and practices, the exhibition explores the connections between craft and performance; the opportunities provided by new technologies and materials; and the power of rethinking craft’s interactions with architecture and space.

This exhibition is the first of its kind within an encyclopedic museum to explore the broad possibilities of contemporary artistic engagement with craft. By examining these interactions in proximity to historical examples in the MFA’s collection, “Crafted” demonstrates the vitality, viability, and variety inherent in choosing craft as a foundation for contemporary artistic practice.

Nature, Sculpture, Abstraction, and Clay 


100 Years of American Ceramics


This exhibition explores ceramic art from the late 19th century to today–from the Arts and Crafts movement to Midcentury Modernism to Studio Craft and contemporary practice. Outstanding works that display the transformative nature of clay include objects drawn from the MFA’s rich holdings as well as a number of local private collections. The exhibition features more than 70 works organized into three thematic sections: Sculpture and Abstraction, Nature and Landscape, and Surface and Decoration. Many of the objects have never before been on display in a museum, with the majority making their MFA debut. Pushing the boundaries between functional and sculptural, the works demonstrate unprecedented experimentation not only with forms, colors and glazes, but also with the role of clay as an artistic and sculptural medium. Highlighting the connections between contemporary art and the art of the past, the exhibition explores each generation’s distinct style, examining how the potter has been redefined as an artist, and how ceramics have been redefined as a vehicle for artistic expression. Diverse highlights includeThe Pine tile manufactured by Grueby Faience Company around[masked], Gourd-shaped vase form (model no.J821) by Gertrud and Otto Natzler from 1958, and a newly acquired porcelain sculpture, December (2013) by Cheryl Ann Thomas.
results.name: MFA free Wednesday Art of Craft

We play Settlers of Catan, Ticket to Ride, Munchkin, and may others.

 Got a game you want to play? Bring it, we are willing to learn and if we can work it into the rotation we will.

Otherwise just bring the ability to forgive the robber for stealing your sheep.

The ability to overlook how the other Munchkin players have stopped you from getting past level 9 ten times in a row and suddenly your down to level 8. Just breath, in and out, in and out.

Recent lesson learned: Never pull a ticket for NY to LA when another player only has 8 trains left. Keep those eyes open.

results.description:
Are you overseeing or taking care of others in your family, community or neighborhood? Do you feel overwhelmed or stressed by the conflicting demands from your role as a working or employed daughter, son or friend caring for your parent, relative, longtime family friend, neighbor or spouse? Do you sometimes feel like you need more confidence and skills in how best to do this? Do you need more practical tips, information, skill demos, guidance or help but do not qualify for public support and don't also have adequate means to pay private providers for ongoing one-on-one guidance and help with your sick or aging relative? Do you feel left out of the available private and public support systems? Do you feel like you need to connect and interact more with people facing similar circumstances? Do you sometimes ask yourself who is taking care of you? Have you ever considered that by taking the time to take better care of yourself, you will have more to give? Do you ever wonder how others are doing it? You are not alone. Come meet, join, have fun, shape and benefit from the activities of this group with other wonderful, caring individuals.


Looking forward to meeting you all,

Rose, Organizer
results.name: Givers of Care, Our Monthly Meetup is Coming Up!

results.description:
We hope you'll join us for an advanced talk about dependency inversion and dependency injection, which are part of the 5 SOLID principles for writing flexible and maintainable object oriented code. 

Our speaker Mike Toppa will first review some key concepts for object oriented programming in PHP. He'll then discuss the benefits of writing small classes, how to do class auto-loading, and explain how to get your objects working together through the use of an injection container. He’ll also cover more advanced techniques for managing multiple object dependencies, dynamic dependencies, and dependencies within dependencies.

Speaker bio:
Mike Toppa has been coding for the web since the days of HTML 1.0, and he's been working with PHP for over 10 years. He moved to Boston from Philly just last month, and he’s the CTO for Poka Yoke Design. Mike was previously the Director of the Web Applications Group at the University of Pennsylvania School of Medicine. He's also worked at Stanford, Georgetown, Ask Jeeves, E-Trade, and the 7 person start-up ElectNext. Outside of work you will most likely find Mike embroiled in a Nerf gun battle with his two young boys. You can find him online at toppa.com and @mtoppa


Agenda:

6PM - 7PM Free pizza

7PM - 7:15PM Announcements

7:15PM - 8:15PM

8:15PM - 8:30PM Q&A

9PM Beers at Champions Bar in Kendall Square
results.name: Dependency Inversion and Dependency Injection in PHP

results.description:
Couch to 5K Fall Group
Interested in getting in shape but don’t know where to begin? Want to meet s

We have 2 groups:

1. Our Jogging Group has a goal of jogging a 5K.
2. Our Alumni Jogging Group has a goal of keep jogging for those who have jogged at least once season with us.

We introduce people to jogging and getting fit. The program gradually moves you from walking at your own pace to jogging at your own pace.

• FREE 10-week program to get you from the couch to running a 5K (3.1 miles) 

• Anyone from the community can participate

• Led by experienced runners

• Monday through Thursdays 6pm-6:45pm; Sundays 8am-8:45am, with a goal of joining us 3 of these sessions per week.

• 45 minute time commitment

• Goal of jogging and finishing the Stow Gobbler on Thanksgiving morning.

Encourage those you love to get “off the couch” and join you in the great sport of running. Come have some fun! Bring a water bottle and join the group.

Please consult your doctor if you have a health or medical condition that prevents you from exercising.

For more information please visit http://www.connectingpointchurch.org/couchto5k/
results.name: Couch to 5K Autumn Edition

results.description:
The Revolve Nation's Boston Entrepreneurs Network is the largest community of entrepreneurs and business owners in the city of Boston, offering networking, discussion groups, seminars, business plan hot-seats, and more!

Join us here, where professionals and entrepreneurs meet in mutual support of business to network, socialize, learn, and promote a thriving community of entrepreneurs. Wine and snacks provided!

Schedule:

6pm-6:30pm  -- Open Networking over wine and snacks

6:30-6:45pm  -- Meeting Called to Order and Introductions

6:45--7:45pm -- Open discussions on topics of interest to our members (examples; Getting funded, building a team, using mailing lists and their effectiveness, firing a difficult employee) Suggest your own topics as comments on the event, or simply bring them with you!

7:45-8:00pm  -- More Networking! (and wine!)

Like anything in life, what you put into a networking group is what you get out of it. The Boston Entrepreneurs Group is designed for entrepreneurs and professionals who are serious about building their business, investing in relationships, and helping each other to succeed.

The way the group seeks to achieve these outcomes:

1) Regular attendance

2) Dedication to coming prepared to contribute value to the community with expertise, experience, and networks.

3) Create a fun and supportive environment!

Price: FREE

SPONSORS: Revolve, Inc.: www.revolvethis.com

Exemplar Law: www.exemplarcompanies.com

See you soon!
results.how_to_find_us: Please be sure to enter on Summer Street, take the escalator to the second floor where you will present identification to security and then proceed to the 19th Floor.
results.name: Revolve Nation Boston Entrepreneurs: Networking & Discussion Group

results.description:
WE ARE BACK IN DAVIS SQUARE FOR TONIGHT, PLEASE TAKE NOTE OF THIS.

6:30-6:45 pm - Warm up & practice, we'll work on some throws, passes & catches.

6:45 pm - Game starts.

General guidelines: Dress accordingly. Bring a white & dark shirt so we can easily divide into 2 teams. Have plenty of water. Sunscreen on a sunny day. Stretch & warm up. We'll provide discs and cones.

Weather: Rain in New England is unpredictable. We will send out a final notice one hour before start time if cancellation is necessary.

RSVP: Very helpful as this is how we contact you in case of game changes & cancellations.

About: Playing Ultimate is all about good sportsmanship, respect, and gracefulness on the field.  Fun & having a good time is a must above anything else. It's an easy game to pick up & we keep the rules minimal. No zones, no stall count, no scores, and players self-officiate on the field.  Open to all levels of players.  Beginners welcome.

Warning: Excessive fun & comradery developed from playing Ultimate may become addicting.
results.name: Weekly Pickup Game (Wednesday) at HODGKINS PARK

results.description:
In the summer of 1630, a thousand people with dwindling supplies of food and medicine stepped off their boats into a seeming wilderness. They lived in caves, wigwams, and tents. In winter, Boston Harbor froze solid for two months; food began to run out. Rose A. Doherty recounts the first dangerous years when nearly half of the original Puritans either died or fled back to England, and she explores how the survivors persevered in the place that became the city of Boston. Doherty is president of The Partnership of the Historic Bostons, Inc., and is the author of Katharine Gibbs: Beyond White Gloves.

FREE
results.name: Survival: Boston 1630: A Lecture

results.description:
All Attendees MUST register on Eventbrite for Headcount Purposes: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/recfen-boston-september-meetup-tickets-18364329203

Welcome to the first Boston RECFEN Meetup Group to be held on September 9th from 6:00 p.m. to 9:00 p.m. EST!

Patch of Land,a peer to peer real estate crowdfunding company offering high yield, asset backed real estate debt via its online investment platform, is leaving the corporate headquarters in LA to host a Boston Centric event to coincide with the release of the Boston Real Estate report.  Executives from Patch of Land, as well as from Real Estate Crowdfunding Platform PeerRealty, will be educating the audience in a networking event and panel discussion.  All are welcome to attend this free event to learn more about how real estate crowdfunding can assist you in your real estate financing and investing needs.

By attending this event, you will learn & benefit personally as follows:

What real estate crowdfunding is and how it can help your business The different types of crowdfunding available to meet your specific needs Network with other investors in the area and with experts within crowdfunding Receive additional freebees & collateral from the co-organizers of the event


Speakers:

Marco Rivera, Marketing Manager of Patch of Land

Daniel Kelly, Head of Marketing of PeerRealty

Rick Scherer, Vice President of MSA Mortgage

Date, Time, Location:

Wednesday, 9/9/15

6:00 - 9:00 pm. EST

At

COALITION BOSTON

101 ARCH STREET, SUITE 1950 BOSTON MA 02110

About Marco Rivera, Marketing Manager of Patch of Land

Marco Rivera assists in the creation, development, and fascilitation of Patch of Land's integrated marketing communications plan.  His background in retail financial services stems from working with companies such as BMO Harris and JP Morgan Chase. His previous experience as a residential appraiser, as well as a foreclosure specialist, give him special insight into the real estate industry from a marketer's perspective.

Marco earned his bachelor of science in Business and Economics with an emphasis in Marketing.He's an editor for various online publications and has maintained partnerships with media and production companies. His wide range of skills and resources make him a great asset to the Patch of Land team.

About Daniel Kelly, Head of Marketing of PeerRealty


Daniel Kelly is the Head of Marketing at PeerRealty. Daniel is responsible for developing, implementing and overseeing the company’s marketing efforts on both traditional and digital channels. Prior to joining PeerRealty, Daniel worked as a litigation attorney at several Chicago law firms. Daniel has over six years of legal experience, including white collar criminal and civil defense and complex commercial litigation work. Daniel also has formal digital marketing training through completing the Startup Institute's Technical Marketing program.PeerRealty is a Chicago-based real estate crowdfunding platform and secondary market for crowdfunded assets; bringing access, transparency and flexibility to a growing industry. At PeerRealty we believe that no investment portfolio can be truly diversified without a real estate component, and we offer investors the opportunity to participate in large-scale commercial and multi-family real estate deals. We have created a platform and secondary market that will allow investors to participate in institutional-quality real estate deals with the nation's most reputable developers for a fraction of the usual barrier to entry, while also creating liquidity in a formerly illiquid market.

About Rick Scherer, Vice President of MSA Mortgage


Rick began his career in the mortgage industry in 2001 after graduating from Bentley University with degrees in Finance and Marketing. In his successful career as a Senior Mortgage Planner, Rick has funded 1 billion in loan volume throughout the New England area. Rick takes pride in helping first time home buyers achieve home ownership but also enjoys working with clients purchasing their next dream home.

Rick also specializes in financing condominiums and multifamily homes for both owner occupancy and investment purchases. He enjoys sharing his extensive knowledge in all aspects of real estate and hosts Real Estate Radio Boston on WBZ NewsRadio. When Rick is not in the office working for his clients, he enjoys spending time with his wife, daughter and son, boating and skiing depending on the season.

Contact Us:

We look forward to meeting you in person in Boston and should you have any logistical questions, please reach out to [masked] for our community manager Manolis Sfinarolakis, or on his cell phone at[masked]-2462.  Feel free to download the Boston Report prior to attending to read our research paper on why Boston is a HOT SPOT for real estate investinghttp://landing.patchofland.com/boston.

Healthy, Fit & Fun promotes exercise and good health in a fun, group setting. People of all ages and abilities are encouraged to come get fit and make new friends while enjoying the beauty of the Esplanade. The Esplanade Association partners with organizations around Boston to offer a diverse array of expert-led fitness classes. All classes are free and open to the public. Registration is required to participate you may pre- register at the event.


Fusing Latin rhythms and easy to follow moves, nothing is more fun and healthy than a high energy Zumba workout. Routines feature interval training sessions where fast and slow rhythms are combined with resistance training. Come get your groove on and break a sweat on the Esplanade. Classes begin 7/14 Classes sponsored by Healthworks. Refreshments provided by Zico and CLIF.

By pre-registering you will receive email updates with any class changes or cancellations.

Help to support their free public programming - make a donation.

results.description:
Boston Traders' Meetup

You are invited to attend the monthly Boston Traders' Meetup meetings.

The format for the monthly meetings is that each person will introduce her- or himself and state the market that he or she trades and perhaps a very brief description of the approach taken. For example, an introduction could be, "Hi, my name is Fred Hampton and I trade forex breakouts during the London session."

From there, the floor is open for people to discuss anything about trading. You may talk about something you learned recently about trading or about an obstacle that you are facing in trading or make a request for resources from other members.

Please print out and bring this BostonTradersMeetup sign so you can connect with the other members easily.
www.meetup.com/BostonTraders/files/

Part of the purpose of this group is for people to connect with other traders so it's encouraged for people to exchange contact info. For example, if you are an options trader and another options trader talks about a topic that interests you, then feel free to ask the person if she or he would like to exchange contact info.

--------------------


This meeting is located in the Starbucks inside what is called the "Boston Marriott" even though the hotel is located in Kendall Square, Cambridge. The Kendall Square subway stop is a Red Line stop at "Kendall."

This meeting is FREE and it repeats on the 2nd Wednesday of every month.
results.name: Boston Traders' Meetup Group Meeting 2nd Wednesday at 6 PM in Cambridge

group.name: Boston Traders Meetup to Teach/Learn Trading Strategies

results.description:
This event is sponsored by AKAMAI.

Concurrent Programming in Java 8

Concurrent Programming is notoriously hard. But is it difficult because humans aren't very smart, or because we often use the wrong abstractions? Java 8 brings greater expressiveness to the language, and allows concurrent programs to be more readable and reasonable. This talk introduces a few concurrent programming paradigms, and offers a deep dive into Deterministic Dataflow, which allows sequential algorithms to be systematically parallelized. We'll learn how choosing the right abstraction in a functional language allows us to pare away extrinsic complexity, and make concurrent programming pleasant.

Presenter

Morgan Creighton is a software enthusiast and dynamic speaker with many years of programming experience. Some decades after graduating from Harvard he is happy to return as an extension school instructor, and hopes you'll take his course on concurrent programming. Morgan's interest in the topic was sparked way back then while developing novel algorithms for signal processing on parallel architectures. He has spent the intervening years unlearning how to program, and hopes that in a few more decades he may finally get it right.
results.name: Java and Concurrency:  Programming in Java 8

results.description:
From the MFA website:


"Gordon Parks, one of the most celebrated African American artists of his time, is the subject of this exhibition of groundbreaking photographs of Fort Scott, Kansas—focusing on the realities of life under segregation during the 1940s, but also relating to Parks’s own fascinating life story. 

In 1948, Gordon Parks (1912–2006) became the first African American photographer to be hired full time by LIFE magazine. One of the rare African American photojournalists in the field, Parks was frequently given magazine assignments involving social issues that his white colleagues were not asked to cover. In 1950, Parks returned to his hometown in Kansas to make a series of photographs meant to accompany an article that he planned to call Back to Fort Scott."


Aja Antoine, a young historian, has studied Gordon Parks and his work.  She will lead us in learning about the exhibit and discussing it.  She'll give us a brief introduction before we enter, and lead our discussion afterwards.

Film on Gordon Parks' life and work you might want to check out before or after the meetup: Half Past Autumn


It is free to get into the museum on Wednesday nights.  Donations are welcomed.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll meet at the back entrance (the Fenway side).
results.name: Visit and Discuss Gordon Parks Exhibit at the MFA (on free admission night)

results.description:
SQGNE is kicking off our 22nd season. At our Sept 9th meeting, please come and hear Johanna Rothman's talk about test leadership. As always, we will be providing the world's best pizza from our sponsor - Flatbread Restaurant.

View our website for pre-registration details and driving directions at www.sqgne.org

Topic: What Makes You A Great Test Leader? 

Speaker:   Johanna Rothman

Meeting Date:  Wednesday September 9, 2015

Meeting Time: Networking 6-6:30pm           

Discussion: 6:30-8pm

Location:    Oracle Campus

  45 Network Drive Northwest Park               

  Burlington MA 01803

Cost:          Free! 

Abstract:   

We've heard that leaders eat last or that they ask why. We've heard that leadership is doing the right things or influencing others. We've heard that leaders have the vision and take people where they want to go. Leadership might be all of those things. Does that describe you as a test leader?

Great test leaders lead from their personal mission. They adapt to their context. They can solve problems, not alone, but with others. They develop other people, so they can create an organization that has more capacity than it did before.

We'll discuss missions and how they work to help you do great work and not do work that is meaningless. Learn how you can increase your adaptability and perseverance, hallmarks of a great leader. Consider how you might solve problems across the organization, helping other people develop their skills for their benefit and the organization.


Speaker Bio: 

Johanna Rothman, known as the "Pragmatic Manager," provides frank advice for your tough problems. She helps organizational leaders see problems and risks in their product development so they can remove impediments.
Johanna is the author of these books:

• Agile and Lean Program Management: Scaling Collaboration Across the Organization

• Project Portfolio Tips: Twelve Ideas for Focusing on the Work You Need to Start & Finish

• Diving for Hidden Treasures: Finding the Value in Your Project Portfolio- Predicting the Unpredictable: Pragmatic Approaches for Estimating Cost or Schedule

• Manage Your Job Search- Hiring Geeks That Fit- Manage Your Project Portfolio: Increase Your Capacity and Finish More Projects

• The 2008 Jolt Productivity award-winning Manage It! Your Guide to Modern, Pragmatic Project Management

• Behind Closed Doors: Secrets of Great Management- Hiring the Best Knowledge Workers, Techies & Nerds: The Secrets and Science of Hiring Technical People

She is writing a book about agile and lean program management. She writes columns for Stickyminds.com and projectmanagment.com, and writes two blogs on her web site, jrothman.com, as well as a blog on createadaptablelife.com
results.name: SQGNE September Monthly Meeting - kicking off our 22nd Season!

results.description:
We've had a speaker change! Grant Fritchey (@gfritchey) will be presenting Statistics for the New Data Pro

Many performance tuning methods can get your queries to run faster. But the most important thing you can do to improve query performance is to ensure that you have provided the query optimizer within SQL Server with the best possible statistics. This session teaches you what statistics are, how they are generated, and their use within the optimizer. You can take home a better understanding of how the optimizer works with statistics, to write better T-SQL and build better database structures to avoid common issues such as bad parameter sniffing. Help the optimizer help you by maintaining your statistics and get improved query performance.

Grant Fritchey is a SQL Server MVP with over 20 years’ experience in IT, including time spent in support and development. He has worked with SQL Server since 6.0 back in 1995. He has also developed in VB, VB.NET, C#, and Java. Grant has written books for Apress and Simple-Talk. Grant presents at conferences and user groups, large and small, all over the world. He joined Red Gate Software as a product evangelist in January 2011.

Before our main speaker, Andy Mallon (@AMTwo) will be presenting a lightning talk on SSMS Shortcuts.
results.name: Statistics for the New Data Pro - Grant Fritchey

Get in shape before the season!! The leader (Bob Barnes) of the Wedeln Ski and Snowboard Race Team will hold dryland training every Wednesday night this Fall. The workout is great for anyone who wants to get in shape, you do not have to be a skier or racer. Bob's enthusiasm for skiing and training is contagious, he will get you working hard and getting results. All fitness levels are welcome but come ready to sweat. Bob will lead the group in Plyometric based training methods designed to get the leg muscles ready for the season. This is the same workout that he has used for many years to prepare for the ski season.

There is no charge - we are just a bunch of skiers and riders trying to help each other get in shape. Darlene Stokes and Tom Lane will also lead the group in additional exercises designed to increase flexibility and build a strong core. Last year we had many people from Meetup join us for these workouts. Some even became regular guests up at our ski house in NH. Ski Fitness Training is a great way to get ready for the season and make some friends you can join on the slopes when the weather gets colder. The workouts last 1.5 hours and are always immediately followed by a few drinks and sometimes some food at a variety of Waltham Center Bars/Restaurants. Please wear work-out clothes and athletic shoes with some ankle support.

The book: The Six-Gun Tarot by R.S. Belcher is a steampunk fantasy, Western… (and I think YA… I swear when I first saw the title it was on a YA list? Whatever.) The synopsis is:

Nevada, 1869: Beyond the pitiless 40-Mile Desert lies Golgotha, a cattle town that hides more than its share of unnatural secrets. A haven for the blessed and the damned, Golgotha has known many strange events, but nothing like the primordial darkness stirring in the abandoned silver mine overlooking the town. Bleeding midnight, an ancient evil is spilling into the world, and unless the sheriff and his posse can saddle up in time, Golgotha will have seen its last dawn… and so will all of Creation.

The venue: A brewhouse run by a local brewery that serves some bites and meals. (Menu is here.) If it's still nice enough, we can try to sit outside to kick back, drink some beer, and discuss the book.
results.name: The Six-Gun Tarot at American Fresh Brewhouse in Assembly Row
